title: King GK
author: King GK
content: Greetings, The idea is approximately ot reduce of BitcoinTalk account load in term of space and speed ⏩  on the server and also by implementing the idea will help to save space, money and increase the website load time.ldeawhile searching for some topic we found many post related to "Banned/Block" user who are no longer part of this forum, and deleting the banned user data/record will save a lot of space and also reduce the record per search term. This will also there will be fewer record in the Database and the query will be expected fast.Note÷ you can create a backup of files in case ones may need it in the future.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: King GK on March 03, 2023, 06:38:49 PM  Greetings, The idea is approximately ot reduce of BitcoinTalk account load in term of space and speed ⏩  on the server and also by implementing the idea will help to save space, money and increase the website load time.ldeawhile searching for some topic we found many post related to "Banned/Block" user who are no longer part of this forum, and deleting the banned user data/record will save a lot of space and also reduce the record per search term. This will also there will be fewer record in the Database and the query will be expected fast.Note÷ you can create a backup of files in case ones may need it in the future. Some things I'd say to this:* I think that some (many!) of those posts are supposed to stay. Else the user would be nuked (and then his posts are indeed deleted) instead of banned.* By your logic, if somebody is banned by mistake and gets reinstated, a revert or some sort of merge would be needed. Unpleasant.* I'm far from certain that removing those posts would bring so much of a speed increase: I expect users table and posts table be separated.* Sooner or later we should migrate to new forum software, so drastic changes are expected to not happen here. But sadly this takes much longer than most have expected.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: First of all, I do't think it's issue. Bitcointalk loads fast as it supposed to be and I haven't seen complaints about it. Second, I don't see reasons to delete data of banned users. I agree with post above that most of these posts should stay. Don't foget that banned users isn't always just plagiators or spammers. Often they have something contributed something valuable over their time here. So, these things should stay for history.And finally, I'm not even sure about your suggestions and how much actually it would help to improve speed of forum.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Larger database record doesn't always mean to slower query or fetching records. Many aspects that it can affect like the kind of select query, index usage, its engines, etc.Using a strong server/resources and proper query, it will not matter even a bit.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Maybe your Internet connection or device has a problem. The forum loads at a pretty much reasonable speed. Way faster than so many websites.Deleting banned user data is not good. Some members were good contributors in the past. Why would you want to trash those contributions. This is like getting rid of part of the forum's history.Deleting the posts would also lead to a lot of unreadable threads in case someone is trying to follow up on the replies. Imagine a thread has 50 replies and 15 of them have been deleted because they were from banned users. Imagine how had it can be to read through that thread.

comments.author: Eureka_07
comments.body: Quote from: King GK on March 03, 2023, 06:38:49 PM<snip>It will help lessen the stress from the database correct, but removing those posts are not the proper workaround. The thing is that, a post should not be deleted regardless if the poster was banned or not, unless it is irrelevant and goes against the forum rules. Also, I believe the stress that the server/database is currently receiving is not enough for it to process the data slower upon logged in. It's all perfectly fine. Go check your internet speed.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: It is better to check your internet speed or what pages are running slow? The forum is running on an old version of Khaled, and it is assumed that it does not require a large amount of data to run, and therefore a good response even if the internet speed is low.Only ANN topics (that have with many pictures,) or ;all that need some time.As for the data, the forum contains text discussions, which are easy to store because they do not require much space.

comments.body: Satoshi's account is technically blocked/banned (and some of stickied topics were written by banned users). Are you really sure you want to delete these kinds of accounts ?

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: I do not think that the problem of loading the forum page is a big problem. Personally, the page loads quickly enough for me, and I think it is the same for most members. Also, the search is not slow and I find it acceptable.Anyway, thank you for your suggestion, but in my opinion there are other things that are more important than the page loading speed. We need to add many features and tools that make using the forum easier, such as mentions, notifications, etc. I think they will all be available in the new version, so we just have to wait.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: robelneo on March 04, 2023, 12:58:45 PMI have no problem with Bitcointalk website loading on my endMe neither. But it got me thinking: for years, I've been scraping the forum, and that link is by no means my only scraper. Let's assume I've downloaded one page every 4 seconds, for the past 4 years. That would be 31 million page loads. Give or take a few. I also know I'm not the only one doing this.As far as I know, Bitcointalk has no problems with this as long as I stay under the 1 page/second limit.

By the way, this topic is still quite interesting, I mean the idea behind it.I rarely use search option on this forum, just tried a little bit long text and when I clicked on search button, it was loading for ages. On short text, it works, just works, not well. I don't think it will improve in near future but the solution provided by OP is really terrible and disastrous. This forum is a 8th wonder of the world and no, I'm not joking, this forum once made a financial revolution and I think we should never delete the information that was posted by Satoshi and other developers, that would be a crime.This forum has Google Search option too that works well but to be honest I think that if you visit Google and type Bitcointalk and then the text that you want to search, you'll find what you are looking for more easily. At least most of my questions were easily answered that way. This forum has so much data, sometimes it's hard to filter it, especially when its search engine is not well-optimized. It needs optimization and improvement, not deletion of golden data.
